definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Explanation: What is that on the horizon?
sentences.chinese: 解读，是什么出现在地平线上呢？

sentences.english: A. silver crescent moon set slowly below the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 一钩银月慢慢从地平线上落下去。

sentences.english: I am convinced that blue skies are already on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 我确信湛蓝的天空已经在地平线上。

sentences.english: Inside the Wolf's foot, the stony horizon.
sentences.chinese: 在狼的蹄子内部，是石头遍布的地平线。

sentences.english: The sun was coming out of the horizon. First it was just a ray of light.
sentences.chinese: 太阳已经升出地平线了，首先是一道光。

sentences.english: Looking at the sky, I am just like a lonely little house slightly stand on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 仰望天空，我只是地平线上一座孤独平微的小屋。

sentences.english: The sun is gradually sinking below the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 太阳正徐徐地沉入地平线下。

sentences.english: Above, a congested street in Lagos sprawls to the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 上图为拉各斯一条拥挤的街道向地平线延展。

sentences.english: What is needed, therefore, is an analytical chapter on “over the horizon” risks.
sentences.chinese: 由此可知，通胀报告得补上一篇“地平线上的风险”。

sentences.english: I have mentioned at least one “perfect storm” brewing on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 我已谈到地平线上正在酝酿至少一场“雷霆风险”。

sentences.english: Deepwater Horizon's failure demoralized the whole nation.
sentences.chinese: 而“深水地平线”的失败则使整个美国都觉面上无光。

sentences.english: The hills rolled toward the horizon.
The sun was a huge ball of fire low on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 落在地平线上的太阳像个大火球。

sentences.english: All that was left of the New York skyline was a chalk cloud.
sentences.chinese: 纽约的地平线上只剩下了一团白云。

sentences.english: Seeing a ship on the horizon, we ran up a flag of distress.
sentences.chinese: 看到地平线上出现一只船，我们连忙升起遇险信号旗。

sentences.english: They faded out in the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 他们消失在地平线上了。

definition: variant of 餘暉|余晖[yu2 hui1]
white (paint from dried fish guts)/marble white color of the dawn sky
the sun sets in the west (idiom)
